cosA=\(BC\over AC\)=\(b_1\over h_1\)(say)
cosP=\(PQ\over PR\)=\(b_2\over h_2\)(say)
it is given, cosA=cosP
\(b_1\over h_1\)=\(b_2\over h_2\)
\(b_1\over b_2\)=\(h_1\over h_2\)=k(say)
using Pythagoras, we get \(BC\over QR\)=\(p_1\over p_2\)=\(\sqrt{h_1^2-b_1^2}\over \sqrt{h_2^2-b_2^2}\)
putting \(b_1=b_2k\) and \(h_1=h_2k\)
we get \(p_1\over p_2\)=k
\(b_1\over b_2\)=\(h_1\over h_2\)=\(p_1\over p_2\)
So by, SSS similarity criteria; triangle(ABC)~triangle(PQR)
this implies that angle(A)=angle(P)
